channel.title: Portforward help!
channel.description:
I tried for hours to portforward but It still doesn't work! I sent my clients to my friends, but they couldn't connect to it, so I downloaded a program called "PFPortChecker" and this is the results. - http://gyazo.com/4331cc4810774606c0fae907a8309c77 (ignore my ip address) changed from TCP -> UDP - http://gyazo.com/72fe2d23f44fcae255ef97e3af8edb28 (ignore my ip address) I watched lots of tutorials and I did the same, but I've different router. My router. - Jensen Scandinavia (AirLink-29150)
Can anyone help me? It'd mean a lot! Add me on skype: xreqii

item.title: Portforward help!
item.dc:creator: @PI_Developer PI_Developer
item.description:
@PI_Developer wrote:

[quote=“Kiddy, post:1, topic:526273”]I tried for hours to portforward but It still doesn’t work!
I sent my clients to my friends, but they couldn’t connect to it, so I downloaded a program called “PFPortChecker” and this is the results.

  • http://gyazo.com/4331cc4810774606c0fae907a8309c77 (ignore my ip address)
    changed from TCP -> UDP
  • http://gyazo.com/72fe2d23f44fcae255ef97e3af8edb28 (ignore my ip address)
    I watched lots of tutorials and I did the same, but I’ve different router.
    My router.
  • Jensen Scandinavia (AirLink-29150)

Can anyone help me? It’d mean a lot! Add me on skype: xreqii[/quote]
http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm

  1. Pick your router, do what it says.

  2. Turn off windows firewall (or you could make 2 exceptions but this will be easier)

  3. http://canyouseeme.org/ - type in 43594 as the port and it should say success, if it doesn’t, you messed up on one of these ^^^

  4. Make sure the client your giving people is connecting to your computer’s ip (since your hosting it from your comp), or your no-ip IP.
    you can find your ip here: http://www.whatsmyip.org/

That’s it

Read full topic
